intro: Oenanthe uhligii, commonly known as the Uhlig's cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many familiar herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are usually lobed. Oenanthe uhligii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
